sigminer: Genomic Alteration Signature Analysis in R Chapter 1 Introduction

sigminer: Genomic Alteration Signature Analysis in R Shixiang Wang, ShanghaiTech University Xue-Song Liu, ShanghaiTech University 2020-03-08 Chapter 1 Introduction Genomic alterations including single nucleotide substitution (SBS), copy number variations (CNV), etc. are the major force for cancer initialization and development. Due to the specificity of molecular lesions caused by genomic alterations, we can generate characteristic variation spectra, called ‘signature’. This package helps users to extract (identify), analyze and visualize signatures from genomic variation records, thus providing new insight into cancer study. The sigminer package can be installed from CRAN or Github: install.packages("sigminer") # or the development version # devtools::install_github("ShixiangWang/sigminer")
